pr_title: Add Fill Option for Inventory Tags

timeline.message:
Add a fill option for inventory tags with opacity spinner

add whitespace after 'if'

timeline.body: Instead of adding another option here, I'd advise going the route of multiple toggles, [similar to the approach used in the NPC Indicators Plugin](https://github.com/runelite/runelite/blob/3c7a6380798f9821ec0477ee3746819f69e2897f/runelite-client/src/main/java/net/runelite/client/plugins/npchighlight/NpcIndicatorsConfig.java#L37-L78) so users can optionally enable outline, underline, and/or fill. (Maintaining the opacity option for the fill color is a good idea)
timeline.bodyText: Instead of adding another option here, I'd advise going the route of multiple toggles, similar to the approach used in the NPC Indicators Plugin so users can optionally enable outline, underline, and/or fill. (Maintaining the opacity option for the fill color is a good idea)
timeline.bodyHTML: Instead of adding another option here, I'd advise going the route of multiple toggles, similar to the approach used in the NPC Indicators Plugin so users can optionally enable outline, underline, and/or fill. (Maintaining the opacity option for the fill color is a good idea)
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

replies.bodyText: I removed the DisplayMode enums and followed the approach shown in the NPC indicators for multiple toggles. I also lowered the default opacity to 50 because 100 felt a little too opaque. Thanks.
replies.author: 1jz

timeline.message:
Add a fill option for inventory tags with opacity spinner

add whitespace after 'if'

create multiple toggles for tag styles

timeline.body: I suppose these can be replaced with `ColorUtil.(MIN|MAX)_RGB_VALUE` given opacity is also represented by the same range

timeline.bodyHTML: I suppose these can be replaced with ColorUtil.(MIN|MAX)_RGB_VALUE given opacity is also represented by the same range
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.body:
This should more closely match the existing display style config.
```suggestion
			name = "Tag display mode",
			description = "How tags are displayed in the inventory",
```
timeline.bodyText:
This should more closely match the existing display style config.
  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            			name = "Tag style",
          
          
            
            			description = "The tag style of highlighted items",
          
          
            
            			name = "Tag display mode",
          
          
            
            			description = "How tags are displayed in the inventory",
timeline.bodyHTML:
This should more closely match the existing display style config.

Suggested change
name = "Tag style",
description = "The tag style of highlighted items",
name = "Tag display mode",
description = "How tags are displayed in the inventory",
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
final Color fillColor = new Color(color.getRed(), color.getGreen(), color.getBlue(), config.getAlphaValue());
final Color fillColor = ColorUtil.colorWithAlpha(color, config.getAlphaValue());
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.body: This should indicate it only affects the "Fill" display mode
timeline.bodyText: This should indicate it only affects the "Fill" display mode
timeline.bodyHTML: This should indicate it only affects the "Fill" display mode
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.body:
Given the fill + alpha configs must be paired together, I think this order would be better for the modes:

1. Outline
2. Underline
3. Fill
4. Fill opacity
timeline.bodyText:
Given the fill + alpha configs must be paired together, I think this order would be better for the modes:

Outline
Underline
Fill
Fill opacity
timeline.bodyHTML:
Given the fill + alpha configs must be paired together, I think this order would be better for the modes:

  1. Outline
  2. Underline
  3. Fill
  4. Fill opacity
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

timeline.message: image util: simplify fillImage alpha check

inventory tags: add fill tag option

This changes the display mode selector to be several separate options so
that users can select multiple, such as outline and fill.

Co-authored-by: Jordan <Nightfirecat@users.noreply.github.com>
